turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hey, I need to get groceries but I'm on a pretty tight budget this week. Can you recommend some affordable meal ideas?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Certainly! To give you the best recommendations, could you tell me what your weekly grocery budget is, and if you have any dietary restrictions or preferences?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, I'm aiming for about $75 this week. I'm vegetarian, and I really dislike tofu, so nothing with that please. I get so frustrated when I can't find good vegetarian options that are actually budget-friendly!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Understood. Based on your $75 budget and vegetarian preference (no tofu), I can recommend a few options. For example: Lentil soup with crusty bread ($15), bean and cheese burritos ($10), pasta with vegetables ($20). These are suggestions, of course. But how am I supposed to determine what ingredients are available or what the prices of those ingredients are at your local grocery store? The price of groceries varies greatly!

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: That's... a good point about local pricing. Alright, let's try this: Can you give me suggestions that are generally very affordable, assuming I shop smart (e.g., buying in bulk when it makes sense, and checking for sales)? And, what would a good breakfast idea be?
